Sentence: In section I, the narrator recalls the time of Emily Grierson's death and how the entire town attended her (Emily) funeral in her (Emily) home, which no stranger had entered for more than ten years
The townspeople have always believed that the Griersons thought too highly of themselves, with Emily's father driving off the many suitors deemed not good enough to marry his (father) daughter
Grierson's death, the women of the town call on Emily to offer their condolences
